website_summaries.verdict: This raised airbed is great for sleeping, and it is anti-microbial (smell resistant) — extending its lifespan.
pros: Raised edges keep children from rolling off
Antimicrobial treated sleep surface resists odor, mold, mildew and fungus
Built-in SwiftRise 120V performance pump inflates bed in under 2 minutes
cons: Can't hold person's weight if they sit on the edge, but is extremely stable in other parts

website_summaries.verdict: The inflatable mattress that's so comfortable and convenient, house guests who've used it often return home and buy it for themselves.
pros: Taller height makes it more usable for some
Antimicrobial sleep surface resists odor, mold, mildew, and fungus
SwiftRise built-in pump inflates the bed in under two minutes
Support Lock reinforced construction providing lasting, stable support
cons: Too light for its height, which creates balance problems

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months now, and with five cat, it somehow has lived. I don't know if I have sweet and gentle cats, or if this product is tough as nails. Either way, it survived me, a 280 pound woman, sleeping on it, so I am happy. <3
customer_reviews.author: Jae & Kimmi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing air retention, I've been using it nonstop for 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I just moved to a new city and am waiting for my house to close. In the meantime I'm at a friend's. I've been sleeping on this for 2 months and only had to top up the air twice. It's about as comfortable as an airbed can be expected to be. It fills up quickly too. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: ECK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent durability, and much less expensive and hassle free set up and take down.
customer_reviews.text: When my air bed arrived I set it up immediately because we needed the extra sleeping space. We've had it inflated for almost a month now, and it still is holding air, and it is very durable. I think this is probably the best air mattress I've ever purchased. I have a queen size aero-bed, and we like that one also, and it's been very durable. But this Coleman is an excellent mattress for our guests.
customer_reviews.author: James Ziessler

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This mattress is probably the greatest purchase I have ever made on amazon. We travel regularly and have always hauled air mattresses around. Having one that self inflates and self deflates has made my life so much easier! Plug it in, turn the dial, wait a few minutes, and get ready for bed! I used it for an entire week vacation and it held up well, no leaking at all.
customer_reviews.author: Frog Queen

customer_reviews.title: It is AMAZING. Takes 1 min to blow it up
customer_reviews.text: I have recently purchased this mattress for my mom who was visiting for a few weeks. It is AMAZING. Takes 1 min to blow it up. It has been more than a week and it is still in the same shape as it was , no air loss just yet. It is pretty high as well so it does look like an actual bed once you have the comforter on it. I do recommend this product , i think the quality is great !!!
customer_reviews.author: yulia

customer_reviews.title: May become defective quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This was awesome when we got it. Was beyond super pleased but after about ten times it got a slow leak in it and it is no longer usable. All the folks who used the bed were small and light and several were kids. No pets around. Will have to throw away and order a new one (but won’t be this one) given other reviews have had similar experiences. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: mom

customer_reviews.title: It was more than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and excellent quality! I recommend this one as a posed to the cheaper $30 air mattresses. Spend the extra $30 or $40 and get one that you'll keep longer and have less problems.
customer_reviews.author: Karnew06

customer_reviews.title: Tipsy-Topsy.....Hang on!
customer_reviews.text: The construction is great. The air/motor is great. However, it is very uncomfortable to sleep/lay on because it is so tipsy. My first guest said it was ok, but my guest this w/e admitted it was horrible to sleep on. No matter how much (or little) air is in it, the whole bed rocks back and forth. I now tried it myself, and I'm embarrassed I didn't try it sooner. Unfortunately, with only 2 guests in 3 months, my return time is past. I'll have to go back to my old 8" single air mattress. I chose this mattress based on the Coleman name.......won't do that again........
customer_reviews.author: jo jo

customer_reviews.title: So very close to 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I sleep on this daily - it inflates in about 2 minutes (after three weeks I've yet to deflate and fold it back up). Due to the material having to go through a stretching period - for a week it would loose some air through the night, but now it suffers no air loss. I'd give it 5 stars if it wasn't for the loud motor (sounds like a vacuum cleaner ).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. Inflates and deflates quickly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Inflates and deflates quickly. Holds air well and is ideal for use with guests who need a bed for more than a night or two.
customer_reviews.author: Seaside Susan

customer_reviews.title: Early joy - deflated...
customer_reviews.text: I’m getting ready to remodel and getting rid of all the old furniture... Needing a temporary bed, I chose the Coleman based on the reputation and the reviews. When the bed arrived I was enthusiastic and pleased. It was comfortable and the height made it even better; however, the enthusiasm quickly deflated along with the bed. After the third week the mattress developed a leak. Thorough examination and no puncture has been found so I’m assuming the leak is through the electric inflation/ deflation pump-valve. I know the mattress was only 60 bucks but it should’ve lasted more than three weeks
customer_reviews.author: W. Holland

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: This is the initial reveiw-Ive yet to actually sleep on it. I aired it up, laid on it and its good comfort and support on the back from what i could tell. Ill post more in a few months to let ya'll know my experience with this. Its nicely packaged, i love the protective carry sack it fits into--takes up less space than a box in the back of my car for when i travel. Ill get back to ya after the 1st time used for a bit. I know I read A ton of reveiws before buying this, so i really hope I made a good worthy buy on this.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Moon

customer_reviews.title: the mattress looks and measures nothing like the product photos or descriptions
customer_reviews.text: After just 3 nights of use, the mattress looks and measures nothing like the product photos or descriptions. Craters about the size of small plates down the middle of the top; sides bulging out giving it the shape of an enormous oval (a FULL size mattress pad can no longer cover the surface of the TWIN mattress); sides provide no support during entry or exit and the bed roles left to right with any shifting during sleep. I'm a 220 lb. male - well within the specs presented in the product description. Very disappointed in this Coleman product - which I can no longer return.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: O.K. but.....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this air mattress for a road trip. It folds up small, so it's easy to pack. The pump works great for inflating and deflating. I used the built in pump with electric and 12 volt both work fine, it also has an outlet for a manual/battery pump when no electric is available. The hight makes it easy to get in and out of, it is very comfortable and held up well on our 68 day road trip. The only problem is the stability, it tends to rock when turning over, it even threw me completely out one night, it rolled over when I got too close to the edge. All-in-all it worked O.K.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Best Air Mattress Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I am camping out in my backyard this summer to beat the heat without running up the utilities bill. The mattress is GREAT! Easy to get in and out of because of its extra height. I followed instructions by inflating it a day in advance to allow the vinyl to stretch. I did not notice any change, but gave it a boost of air anyway. I have been sleeping on this for over a week, and have NOT experienced any leaks. My dogs seem to like the mattress as well.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: DId not last one year
customer_reviews.text: In less than one year, it developed a slow leak somewhere and deflates overnight to half it's height. The mattress is very large so there is really no way to submerge it and look for air bubbles to patch the area. I think it should have lasted much longer. But, I can say, it was good while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: agapi

customer_reviews.title: Worst airbed I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to check out other manufacturers and this one was rated quite strong, however, it wasn't that great out of the box (not very stable on the sides at all) and developed a slow leak quite quickly. Also, the design of the "air coils" is quite annoying in the fact that when you roll over, they make a popping sound that will wake you up unless you are a very heavy sleeper. Intex actually makes a much better product. By far, this is the worst airbed I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander J. Everhart

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality. Since we were moving from one house to another and our furniture was being moved our a few days before our move in and we didn’t want to stay in a hotel, we elected to purchase another inflatable. We already had Coleman inflatable, so knew it was a good product. This new one is even better than the one we already had. It was like sleeping on a normal bed. We are senior citizens, so it’s getting harder to get up from very low positions, but this mattress is a nice hight, obviously not as high as a regular bed, but not bad. Easy to inflate. Deflating and folding are a little challenging, but doable.
customer_reviews.author: Gasper N. Ferraro

customer_reviews.title: This is electric inflatable only
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed because I thought it had a capacity to use ac, batteries, or electric to inflate. I had read some reviews and the person mentioned batteries. I had looked but it was unclear in the description that it was inflatable by electric only. I bought it for my husband to rough camp and needed one that was ac cigarette lighter or battery powered. Well my husband tossed out the box or I would return it. Was kind of expensive but I guess we will keep it. Now I have to look for another one.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen Icanberry-Young

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy mid priced item.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well made product. Very comfortable and easy to put up and take down - and no struggle to put back in the storrage bag! I owned two other brands that did not last/ sprung leaks and needed to be discarded after minimal use. I have used this Coleman bed model for years now. It goes on vacations, camping, set up for guests, and back and forth to our cabin. When it was time to purchace a second single air bed, we bought another one of these. Both are still going strong. Performs like a higher priced ' luxury' bed.
customer_reviews.author: GAM

customer_reviews.title: I bought this mattress for a camping trip and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mattress for a camping trip and the first night I went to sleep and through the night it deflated causing it to almost be impossible to sleep. Filled it up the second evening and still did the same thing. Maybe it had a leak somewhere, but it was fresh out of the box and never used.
customer_reviews.author: jeff blakeman

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I sold our daybed because we didn't have room for it. But, now I needed a twin mattress for family visitors. My stepdaughter slept on it for 2 nights ad said it was very comfortable. I always do a lot of research before buying anything. This had great reviews and the price was reasonable. So, now I'm adding my review to help future buyers. This set up very quickly and I liked that it was high up. Getting out of bed was much easier than those flat on the floor matts.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Nice spare bed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product...this is the second air mattress I have bought by coleman & this one far exceeds the first..very easy to inflate, by the 3rd day, it needed more air. It is loud when it inflates or deflates. This is me but I was very cold on it. Had a sherpa blanket underneath & still awoke chilled. The carrier is very basic but this isnt something that will be used often, so its fine.
customer_reviews.author: kells

customer_reviews.title: Love the height of this new air bed
customer_reviews.text: Love the height of this new air bed, and it is very comfortable. It has a strong plastic odor and the bed linens still smell of plastic after laundering, but hope that will lessen. Easy to inflate/deflate, and stays inflated for several days. A good addition to the closet for occasional overnight guests. The bed is heavy due to the inflating apparatus, but it is manageable. The carry bag is too small, but is not necessary to store it in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality, Easy Operation/Stirage
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used this twin air bed for more than a year with great results. It is very easy to set up and put away, taking only 2-3 minutes to inflate or deflate. You or your guests can also choose inflation amount to create a firmer ir softer bed. When deflating, it is completely flattened so you don’t have to struggle with getting air bubbles out. It folds and rolls up easily and the bag it comes in is ample so you don’t have to struggle to stuff it in there. I put a good plush cover on it, and it’s almost as comfy as a real bed. Great for guests, as it conserves space. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: teabird

customer_reviews.title: Was great until it leaked air after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: I had gotten this for my 19 year old son to use on trips with his percussion group. It made it through 2 uses. The 3rd time he blew it up, it leaked. The mattress is super comfy and does blow up quickly but is useless if it doesn't hold air! We returned it to Amazon. I bought a different brand at a local Walmart so if there is a problem, we can return it it little easier.....
customer_reviews.author: Rhinestone Mom

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one day
customer_reviews.text: I have a friend with a queen air mattress from Coleman that has worked without issue for 8 years or more. It's like sleeping on an expensive mattress. So, I tried the twin bed, and the first morning I woke up on the floor. Tried it a few more times and gave up. Instructions say if you want a refund from Coleman, you must send it back to Coleman, AT YOUR OWN EXPENSE. I'm not paying shipping (16 pounds shipping weight) on a product that lasts one day. These air mattresses are luck of the draw, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: This was great. I bought it because my son was visiting ...
customer_reviews.text: This was great. I bought it because my son was visiting for 10 days and I bought it for him to sleep on Well, he said it was incredibly comfortable, which it was as I tried it and codlin;t be any easier to fill or deflate. Again, a quality item that performs as expected. In fact, this one really exceeded my expectations. Packs very small and flat(ish).
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Folender

customer_reviews.title: This piece of junk sprung a leak in one month ...
customer_reviews.text: This piece of junk sprung a leak in one month. And while it may be "under warranty" who is going to go through the expense and hassle of shipping a bulky, heavy leaky air mattress? I have tried all different brands of air mattresses over the past 3-4 years. No matter the price they all seem to be the same problems. Eventually they go flat. Most cannot be fixed by patching them either. My advice, buy the cheapest ones and just replace them.
customer_reviews.author: E F. Varisco

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic guest bed!
customer_reviews.text: So convenient to use. Fits in bag in closet. We blew it up a week ahead of needing to use it then deflated it. Refilled again to stretch the plastic mattress. No issues of leaking or going soft. On priciple, we gave it a lttle more air each day. We left window open to expell plastic smell for a few days. By time guests came, it was perfect spare bed. Used a mattress topper for more cushiness, but would have been OK without. Note: Although twin bed sheets fit, we further secured with three suspenders slipped under mattress, gripping each side at top, bottom and middle. Sheet stayed taught.
customer_reviews.author: B. S.

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to inflate and deflate
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Coleman Support Rest Twin Elite Air Bed because my sister was going to be staying for a while. She has arthritis and has a hard time rising out of beds/chairs but the height of the mattress made it simple for her. The bed is well-made and did a good job holding the air with slight adjustments throughout the week. The only minor complaint is that it is cold to sleep on. A thermal mattress pad would be an option to take care of that issue. Otherwise, I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Not my real name

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad points, but bad override
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for ease of setup and take down. Comfortability can obviously be adjusted by amount of air. 1 star though for length of life - 6 months to 1 year max if used nightly, even if sitting in an otherwise unused room. Waaaay too short of a shelf-life and way too much waste.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Total fail in less than 60 days.
customer_reviews.text: Slightly less than two months of use and it's ruined. The seaming around one of the "circles" on the top of the mattress has completely failed. There are no pets around, and it's only being slept on 4 days per week by a very normal weight person.
customer_reviews.author: ruth58

customer_reviews.title: hotel beds are terrible. I just can't sleep in them
customer_reviews.text: So far the whole family loves this one! I purchased it as a traveling bed. Since buying our Sleep Number a year a go, hotel beds are terrible. I just can't sleep in them. So I bought this as a way of mimicking the sleep number ability to adjust softness/firmness. My kids ask to sleep on it all the time. They think it's fun. The pump works great for blowing up and for removing the air to store easily. The cover is nice but its hard to get the mattress rolled up well enough to fit in it. Long term I'll probably just use a king sized pillow case. Great product. Don't hesitate to spend the money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Dacian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for visiting grandkids!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 3 of these for visiting grandkids. These Colemans are simply the best. They are self filling and deflating too. And when deflated will actually refit into the storage bag that it came in, ready to be put away until their next visit. These are tall air mattresses, 20 inches tall, more like a real bed and easier to get in and out of. Ours are in the back of a closet til the next grandkid invasion.
customer_reviews.author: Outlawsid

customer_reviews.title: Possible defect in the design.
customer_reviews.text: We bought three of these for our kids to use for a few months while we are in between moves. They are super comfortable and the inflate deflate works well. One is still like new. 2 of them developed a hole in the sameness location. The center oval tore at the seem. No one jumped on them or misused them. Our kids are teenagers not little ones. The fact that they developed these holes in the exact same location makes me wonder if it’s a defect. We have tried patching them and we can’t find a patch that will work. Now I need two more air mattresses and don’t trust that this won’t happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Nebeker

customer_reviews.title: Much easier than keeping track of an external air pump and attachments.  The price wasn't much more for the convenience.
customer_reviews.text: This bed worked out great for when we have house guests. I was extremely happy to not have to deal with another pump and attachment. The built in pump is easy to use and so far no issues at all. It fills up the bed quickly and the bed holds the air for a few days at a minimum (haven't needed it for more than a few days at a time).
customer_reviews.author: M. MayTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: Good and comfy bed!!
customer_reviews.text: This bed is great! It is easy to set up and pretty easy to pack up when done. My niece slept on it for a week on a recent visit and she said it was really comfy. I did splurge for a twin size foam mattress topper since she was going to be using it for more than a night or two and she said it really made the difference. I know there are cheaper ones out there but if you are going to use it for any amount of time this bed is worth the extra few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: VinoSucker

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: Made this purchase to use as a guest bed, it is so comfortable I'm using it as an extra sofa in the TV room. Easy set up, super comfortable, exceptionally made, if I have to travel it is going with me in the car to guarantee I have a perfect bed to rest my head. If your a camper, on the road a lot, need an extra bed for company, do not hesitate to purchase. If you have a small living place you could use this as a bed no problem, it's the best! HIghly recommend, 5 star product
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee L

customer_reviews.title: Can’t get any simpler than this
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a comfortable air mattress that is quick and easy to set up and take down, look no further. Comes in a bag so it’s easy to store. Holds air well and easily adjusts for desired firmness. We left it inflated for several weeks and it held air wonderfully. Really good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: EKM

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to use airbed
customer_reviews.text: My husband was looking for an easy to use, comfortable airbed for overnight golf and camping trips. The bed is very comfortable and so easy to set up. He found it hard to get it back in the provided carry bag and decided to use his own bag to carry it and the sheets he will use. One drawback is that he is 6'1" and his feet hang over the edge of the bed. For him it is about 5 inches too short. Totally our fault and yet another example of how we should have read the fine print on measurements more carefully. I am 5'6" and could sleep on it without hanging over.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaB

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! So glad we took a chance on this one
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a solution to multiple house guests staying an extended period of time and were hesitant to buy an inflatable based on past experience (bulky, deflate quickly, hard to set up ect) So glad we took a chance on this one! Sets up like a dream, plug it in and it's ready in under 3 minutes. It's higher than the older ones I remember so it actually feels and looks more like a real bed. Did not have any issues with it losing air over the course of 3 weeks of daily use and it deflates just as easily as it sets up, light and easy to store. Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Air Bed
customer_reviews.text: While I've only used this air bed once for an overnight guest, she was very pleased with the comfort and no deflation during the night! The added height is a bonus, making it easier for older folks to get on and off. Electric air pump works quickly and relatively quietly. Two minor downsides: When deflated and rolled up, it's much heavier and bulkier than our previous AeroBed; it's darn near impossible to get it back into the included nylon bag. I solved both issues by stuffing it in one of my old Army-issue recksacks.
customer_reviews.author: David HallTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Punctured in its first use and not replaceable even w/ warranty; use with caution or don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I typically buy Coleman products for certain outdoor equipment and unfortunately, this product fell through. I was sleeping on it with a Coleman sleeping bag (figures) and at some point in the night, the zipper of the bag punctured the bed. I was not granted a replacement under warranty even though I had purchased it three months prior and this was its first use. Pretty upsetting as this has been my fourth Coleman bed (other models that were not punctured but gradually failed to hold air), so after this purchase, I'll be switching to other brands for airbeds.
customer_reviews.author: T. T.

customer_reviews.title: DEFLATED on Second Use.....
customer_reviews.text: On the second night this Coleman twin blowup bed was used, it deflated on our guest.....embarrassing! I looked like it would be a good quality product, good brand name, but I was wrong. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: katecache

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought the mattress to sleep on until I found what I wanted to put in my bedroom. It was easy to blow up, and filled with air in minutes. It is as high as most regular beds so not hard to get in or out of. I don’t even want to get a bed and mattress cause it’s so comfortable. The only issue I am having is the sheets don’t stay on when you sleep. So far I been sleeping in it for about 2 weeks and love it wish I could find sheets that coved the whole mattress
customer_reviews.author: Diane Dukes

customer_reviews.title: Deflates by half over night
customer_reviews.text: It deflates by half just overnight. I've used it only 2 nights - no holes or anything, but it does leak substantially. Trusting the reviews here (based on which I made my purchase), I'm requesting an exchange, assuming its just a defective item that I've gotten. I hope a replacement item will be of a better quality.
customer_reviews.author: bookinist_09

customer_reviews.title: Will not last long term; even with mild use
customer_reviews.text: At first worked great. I used it about once every two months. It was stored properly each time. Now a year later it deflates half way with each use. So not a leak, just poor quality. This was clearly not meant to last.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great bed!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bed! You pump it up with the air (plug in). Then you take the air out with the pump- super quick. Be sure to open the other plastic air socket to the left of the pump when taking the air out. This held the air all night. Great for sleepovers.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Great air mattress.
customer_reviews.text: We use this air mattress a few times a week and it is holding up very well. One of the most comfortable air mattresses I've ever slept on. very supportive and the height is great for getting in and out of the air bed. Im 6'2" and it fits me very well, a little short but not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it's good!
customer_reviews.text: After having surgery on my femur and hip, I'm not able to go upstairs. I've had multiple surgeries over the last few years and fed up sleeping on the couch. I decided to try this out. I'm sleeping better for sure. I move the airbed against the wall during the day so it's out of the way. For the next few months, I will continue to use it until I can go upstairs again. I'm pleased with this item as a temporary solution.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Hamdoun

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pump up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to pump up, easy to deflate, but best of all easy to get up from!!! It has a very comfortable height--like a normal bed!!! I will no longer be reluctant to put my elderly guests on one of these. Deflated, it rolls up into a nice compact item. It comes with a storage sack, but the sack needs to be slightly larger as it's a bit difficult to stuff the mattress into.
customer_reviews.author: H. Catalfo

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect air mattress
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding product. I have had many air mattresses, and they all get holes in them and become useless. But not Coleman! This mattress is really like a bed. It's SO TALL, and has a luxurious feeling. So easy to set up and take down. I'm likely to buy several more of them, as I have frequent houseguests. A fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: ELF

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: When my mother was on hospice, my daughter, sister, and I slept on these airbeds in the same room with Mom. I know we used them well over a week and each person slept comfortably. I did find we aired them twice to make them firmer but it's done easily and quickly. My daughter borrowed one for New Year's Eve as not to drive home from friend's party. They deflate easily and have a storage bag. Sturdy and twin sheets fit well.
customer_reviews.author: ChattyCathy

customer_reviews.title: Two creates a king .......
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these to stage a house ! Created a reasonable King bed ! I'm sure I will get to use them for guests after the house sells , but the 20" height mimics a real bed perfectly.FOLLOW UP ........ these loose their shape completely without physical use .
customer_reviews.author: WNC Mountains

customer_reviews.title: Comfy,  Holds Air, Easy
customer_reviews.text: This air mattress was terrific during a move. It held air each night during 7 night use. A bit of air escaped during night but only slightly. I never was even close to finding myself on the floor and the amount of lost air didn't wake me up. It was super easy to inflate, deflate, fold into bag and it was relatively comfortable. Through reviews on Amazon I understood Coleman was a top brand. So glad this was my choice. Deserves top rating
customer_reviews.author: Norma B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: My daughter recently moved and was in her apt for a full month before her furniture arrived. Originally, she had purchased a different air mattress. Within days that mattress got a hole in it and she woke up laying on the hardwood floor. I ordered this mattress for her and couldn't be happier! This mattress was easy to inflate and it held the air extremely well. Since it was the only furniture she had, my daughter slept on this and had to use it as a couch, so it got a lot of use! Extremely pleased with this air mattress and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Mary V.

customer_reviews.title: A real bed
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of time in the mountains camping. Use to have a cot. Thought I'd give this a shot. I'll never sleep on a cot again. It's like I hauled my bed from home with me. Built in pump takes about 2 minuets to inflate. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: nailer

customer_reviews.title: Stays firm
customer_reviews.text: I love the way the mattress stayed firm all night long and my guest slept like a baby. I hope it stays that way for the rest of his stay with us. I also love the outside chamber which is a little higher than the bed itself. It creates a very comfortable sleeping alcove. I highly recommend this mattress to anyone who is looking for a comfortable sleeping solution for a guest without spending money on a new bed. It takes minutes to inflate and deflate with no fuss. LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: Lillian

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for an air matress
customer_reviews.text: Nice for an air bed. Of course, it's not a fancy mattress that takes into consideration your individual needs for support, so don't get unrealistic about it. It's an air mattress, after all. I've used mine quite a bit. I need a soft sleeping surface and it's fine for me for a couple nights or 3. Wouldn't want to use it long-term or anything. Holds air well. Inflates and deflates pretty quickly too.
customer_reviews.author: lucypevensie

customer_reviews.title: A deflating experience
customer_reviews.text: Planning for visit to see new baby in the family. Needed an extra bed urgently. Made a quick decision based on positive experiences from childhood camping trips -- my dad always used Coleman products (lanterns, stoves, etc.). Unfortunately, this bed loses air immediately and is uncomfortable even when it is recently inflated. Can't return it because I had it shipped somewhere else to await our arrival and it was already unpacked.
customer_reviews.author: PSSAT

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This bed gets used in a tent, for company and even when I needed a bed downstairs after hip replacement surgery. It is y’all enough to make up like a bed and easy to get in and out off. Very comfortable and often gets left inflated after it is needed, just for taking little naps on the back patio.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Marquardt

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered on a Sunday and I left for camping on Monday. The pump works great. I pumped it up at least 2 hours before using as in the instructions. The temps have been in the 70s during the day and down to 50s overnight. I’ve not had to add any air and the twin sheet set fits. Great deal so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was pleased with it until I noticed a leak had developed
customer_reviews.text: Started leaking the week after the return window closed. Fancy that. I was pleased with it until I noticed a leak had developed.
customer_reviews.author: Gus Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three of these and I love them! I use them for when guests stay over at my place and I only get compliments. They are very easy to inflate because it comes with a built In pump where you just plug in and turn on the switch. They inflate in about 5 minutes! They are also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: too tall, leans over
customer_reviews.text: Lovely Bed, but if you like to move around on your bed. Be prepared to catch yourself. This bed is so tall that I constantly have to catch myself from falling out of it. It starts leaning on me. Very Annoying. I guess its too tall for me. Im going to buy a double tall instead of this triple tall.
customer_reviews.author: UndergroundSk8r

customer_reviews.title: It needs 120v Outlet for inflation!
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the functionality of the built in inflator, except that you have to use the house plug and not a car cigar lighter socket. Took it to a mountain bike event, to inflate and sleep in my van...had to find a 120 outlet and then plug an inflated mattress around the event...fail!
customer_reviews.author: Lozza on an XCal

customer_reviews.title: Soft and elastic mattress top and cheaper than other alternatives
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I am here because of a bad manufacturing error in the design of another mattress; with that said I am kind of glad I was pushed here. The pillow top material seems to be very soft and elastic so that makes it easy on my hips, breasts and back. The height of it is always a bonus and the width was actually a surprise I enjoy. Over all: great buy, comfy and cheaper than other 20 in. Y’all air mattresses.
customer_reviews.author: Dezzi Jacks

customer_reviews.title: I never have good luck with air beds - they stop holding air ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought a bigger size, but this one is holding up well, no complaints so far. I never have good luck with air beds - they stop holding air after 3 or 4 days. This one has lasted a whole week, which is amazing. It's too narrow to be very comfortable for an adult, but it's fine for travel and for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Catmom

customer_reviews.title: It was very comfortable to sleep on my Grandson is 6"2 and slept ...
customer_reviews.text: So thrilled over this purchase. sets up in a couple minutes just as fast taking down! It was very comfortable to sleep on my Grandson is 6"2 and slept on it comfortably. I hope it lasts for the purpose we use it. A little more than what I wanted to pay but you don't mind spending the money if it is everything that is advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Sherer

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Loved how simple this mattress was to set up and deflate. Unfortunately I gave it a four star because after using it for a week there was small nick in it. I could have been our fault but I am unsure. The hole was by the corner of the plastic intake so it was easy to find and repair. Great price!
customer_reviews.author: The Buckouts Blessings

customer_reviews.title: Happy Shopper
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, works exactly the way it’s described. Fast to inflate fast to deflate super comfy. We used it for a week and a half and I could’ve slept on it way longer. We had a guest and I only have one bedroom so I gave them my bedroom and slept on this did not miss a beat. Highly recommend it. And it’s a very good price
customer_reviews.author: JuneMoon360

customer_reviews.title: Colman twin air bed
customer_reviews.text: Nice air bed but I fell off the bed a few times. Too close to the edge and the bed tips over very easily
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Ige

customer_reviews.title: Great for Guests
customer_reviews.text: This air mattress is almost the height of an actual bed, which makes it great for guests. Though I haven't slept on it myself, I've received compliments on it from guests and lied down in it for moment. It doesn't feel like you're sleeping on an air mattress!
customer_reviews.author: Crindee

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The middle of the bed is poofed out kind of like sleeping on an big lump that you fall off of every time you move. I've tried to let air out put air in flip over everything but still no better. Very uncomfortable would return if I could missed the window it was meant for my daughter so I didn't immediately realize it was so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Dream.believe1726

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and quick to inflate!
customer_reviews.text: Surprising very comfortable and so easy to both inflate and deflate. Amazingly fast. I like that the sides roll up a bit so your pillow does not fall off and neither do you! Would have liked a queen but only had room for a twin which will do fine in a pinch, but I am 5'4" and I just fit so if you can, go for the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: JUDITH

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: We now have 2 Coleman inflatable beds, a twin and queen. Love them both and so does our company. Easy to inflate and take down and put back in the enclosed bag. Nice height for us oldies to get up and down from too.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Birds Mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for visitors!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect visitor bed! I have family visit quite often and also have a random co-worker need some where to crash for the night or two. This works just perfect. Easy to inflate and deflate, and unpack and pack up when not needed. This is the least expensive Coleman bed that I've found online and in stores.
customer_reviews.author: Anakalia - Red Herring

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: Great air mattress. Just moved to a new city and this has been my everyday bed. Love it. Easy and quick to inflate. 2 weeks gone by and air hasn’t leaked. Warning: it gets cool in cold days, so grab some blankets.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay inflated
customer_reviews.text: This was a huge disappointment. The only positive thing about it was the built in air pump. However, that might also be the problem with it. The mattress does not stay inflated. We pumped it up for a week before trying to sleep on it to "stretch it out" as indicated in the instructions. The first night I tried to sleep on it, it needed to be pumped up 3 times. The second night, it lost so much air I fell out onto the floor when I tried to roll over and the matress ended up on top of me.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy-Lee Hauze

customer_reviews.title: Its VERY comfortable and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: we have someone staying with us and she is using this bed. Its VERY comfortable and easy to set up....LOVE IT! so happy with my purchase! Good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer McBeth

customer_reviews.title: Dat not da Bess !
customer_reviews.text: I spoke too soon about giving it a 5 star review. I've had it for 1-1/2 months and does not hold psi. Disappointed in Coleman Works great ! Best feature is built in pump that not only inflates, but also deflates for easy storing. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: When inflated very comfortable....but it continues to have a slow leak. You cannot hear the leak but it has to be inflated daily for my 8 yr. old grandchild who weighs 62 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great indoor air mattress
customer_reviews.text: My youngest didn’t even realize this was an inflatable bed, she was extremely comfortable on it. My oldest (about 145lbs) slept on it every night for 3 months (she moved back in abruptly- this was bought in a hurry haha) and she didn’t have to reinflate the entire time. Very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Adamo

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Exactly at 1-year mark, after warranty expired, the mattress ripped a hole at a point where some internal "corner" is attached to the outside seam. That's just bad design, and unfortunate timing for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Transport, Easy Set Up, COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Comfy and tall, I love it. If you're using it in cold weather, just make sure to buy sheets that keep the heat in because since it's an air mattress, the cold easily comes through.
customer_reviews.author: Chica5533

customer_reviews.title: Great bed...I sleep on it nightly.
customer_reviews.text: I sleep on this bed every night and I rarely ever have to add air and I am a woman of "Substance" so I can tell you it is super durable. It is a tad less wide than another bed (both twin size) I have had but still is great for a single person (and an occasional grandchild!). My air beds seem to last around a year or so before they spring a leak somewhere but I don't mind spending the money to get a good nights sleep (Fibromyalgia). I highly recommend this bed.
customer_reviews.author: QueenRobyn

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for our daughters home stay of two weeks better than a couch or sleeping on floor. Very restful sleep set up and breakdown easy. Held air for two week stay without need to refill. Accepts standard Doubl xl sheets easily
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I payed a lot more for one of these at ...
customer_reviews.text: I payed a lot more for one of these at Target before I realized they were cheaper here. Same exact item, $25 cheaper – hard to say no to that. Its well built and inflates really quickly. Does not have the auto-reinflate feature that one of my other air mattresses has, but that's a fairly small quibble for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Hines

customer_reviews.title: Great bed
customer_reviews.text: Great little bed. Blows up quickly and power deflates. This enables me to get all the air out for easy packing. Very sturdy when inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Norman W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: and they both had a great month and the one who slept on the air ...
customer_reviews.text: I just had company for a month, one slept in a twin bed and one slept on this air mattress, and they both had a great month and the one who slept on the air mattress said it was really comfortable. and when you made both beds up, you could not tell by looking which was air and which was mattress
customer_reviews.author: J. Mccormick

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this for Great grandmother to sleep on over the Christmas holiday and ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for Great grandmother to sleep on over the Christmas holiday and I worked great! It was easy to inflate and easy for her to get in and out of. The only thing was since it was SO out we had to put a quilt under the sheets to help insulate.
customer_reviews.author: Korder

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bed to accommodate guests for 4 nights. Worked out great. I did not want them to feel like they were sleeping on the floor. This bed is high and very comfortable. And it folds up to next to nothing for storage. It is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Barkasaurus Rex

customer_reviews.title: This Coleman Twin airbed is excellent! So easy to inflate and deflate and it ...
customer_reviews.text: This Coleman Twin airbed is excellent! So easy to inflate and deflate and it remains inflated way longer than other brands I've bought previously. Great quality and I received in 3 days or less. Bought it because I moved from one coast to the other and my furniture still isn't here (after 1 month), so I'm so happy I got this Coleman airbed. Definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Tellez

customer_reviews.title: Get the twin and be comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three of these for a mission trip. They are easy to inflate. They are so comfortable! I just loved them! They did not deflate during the night and were easy to deflate when the time came. Definitely recommend! Love that this is a twin so that you get the bed to yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one week ago exactly and loved it for the first three or four days I had it - I also purchased a foam mattress, sheets, pillows, and a throw and set it up to have something to lie on and read in my living room....then it started losing air. Yesterday I came downstairs and it was flat...blew it up again and today I came downstairs and it was flat again. My disappointment is extreme. Now I have to take all the stuff off it, deflate it and return it. I am sick of returning things that don't live up to their hype on here Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl F.

customer_reviews.title: Twin wobbles when you roll.
customer_reviews.text: I like the height, but the twin size is wobbly. I tend to roll in place during the night and every time I did it woke me up from the wobbling. Wish I had tried it out before it was too late to return it. Now it sits in my closet to collect dust; I won't use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: The best air mattress I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: The best air mattress I've ever used. It actually functioned as a temporary bed for guests for a few months in the second bedroom until I found an actual bed/mattress set. The height is perfect, the built-in motor is quite convenient and fills the mattress quickly. This is well-designed and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SRP

customer_reviews.title: Amazing feels great and blows up quick
customer_reviews.text: PRO:Amazing feels great and blows up quick, super nice to have the pump built in for easy blow and release. CON: if you thought it got cold because of the space between you and the ground before its worse now being so far off the ground. BUT i put a few covers under the sheet and its helped alot to trap body heat. When will someone make a quieter pump lol?
customer_reviews.author: Graidey Marshall

customer_reviews.title: this bed is actually really comfortable. I agree that it could be cold but ...
customer_reviews.text: this bed is actually really comfortable. I agree that it could be cold but if you put a pad and/or a heavy blanket under the sheet it seemed fine. I haven't tried the queen fitted sheet yet but I believe the other reviews because it looks like it should work. I have company coming next week so I will find out for sure, otherwise in the trial run it was comfortable and very sleepable. we like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Coleman SupportRest Elite Double High Airbed, Twin
product_meta.description: Featuring an extra-tall design, the Coleman SupportRest Elite Double High Airbed offers added cushioning and makes it easier to get in and out of the bed. Designed for both indoor and outdoor use, this inflatable mattress is the perfect choice for houseguests or camping trips. The velvet-like plush top offers a soft feel, so you can drift off to sleep in comfort, while the Support Lock reinforced construction provides a more stable sleeping surface. The mattress surface is antimicrobial treated to resist odor, mold, mildew, and fungus, so you can offer the bed to family and friends with confidence. A convenient built-in SwiftRise 120V performance pump inflates the bed in under two minutes, and an AirTight system and Double Lock valve help keep the mattress at the perfect firmness level. The pump also completely deflates the air bed for easier packing and compact storage, and the included carry bag offers hassle-free transportation. The official air bed of the National Park Foundation, this twin air mattress supports up to 300 pounds and fits standard twin size sheets.
feature_bullets: Double high design makes getting in and out of bed easier and offers extra cushioning
Soft plush top with Support Lock reinforced construction for added stability
Antimicrobial treated sleep surface resists odor, mold, mildew, and fungus
Approximate Inflated Dimensions: 75 x 39 x 18 inches ; fits standard twin sheets
Supports up to 300 pounds; designed for indoor and outdoor use

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
